title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that Russia is efficiently using its resources and/or does not explain that it is producing at a point on its production possibilities curve.
The response states that Russia is efficiently using its resources and explains that it is producing at a point on its production possibilities curve.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that Russia has the comparative advantage in the production of bulldozers and/or does not explain that Russia has the lower opportunity cost in producing bulldozers: the opportunity cost of producing one unit of bulldozers in Russia is 0.25 unit of trucks and in China it is 1 unit of trucks.

The response states that Russia has the comparative advantage in the production of bulldozers and explains that Russia has the lower opportunity cost in producing bulldozers: the opportunity cost of producing one unit of bulldozers in Russia is 0.25 unit of trucks and in China it is 1 unit of trucks.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that no, Russia will not gain from trade and/or does not explain that these terms of trade are greater than Russia’s opportunity cost of producing trucks.
The response states that no, Russia will not gain from trade and explains that these terms of trade are greater than Russia’s opportunity cost of producing trucks.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that neither country has the absolute advantage in the production of bulldozers and/or does not explain that after the production of bulldozers doubles, both countries can produce a maximum of 80 units of bulldozers with the same amount of resources.

The response states that neither country has the absolute advantage in the production of bulldozers and explains that after the production of bulldozers doubles, both countries can produce a maximum of 80 units of bulldozers with the same amount of resources.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate the number of unemployed people in China as 8 million and/or does not show the work.
